page.title: 02SLED LANE POND.
page.content: Sled lane Pond is in a hollow on the outskirts of Crawcrook. On one side there is a road with the land sloping upwards and on the other there is quite a steep hill covered with deciduous trees. There is quite a bit of pond vegitation round one side and on the other it is marshy and covered with reeds. There are lily pads floating on the surface in one place. The fish in the pond include minnow, perch, tench and roach, which are caught by fishermen for sport and then put back. Birds live on the pond such as ducks, moorhens and coots. The water abounds in caddis fly larvae, mayfly larvae, waterboatmen, dragonflies, toads, frogs, water scorpions, diving beetles, leeches, water snails, pondskates, newts and fresh water shrimps.
